{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist | Name = Wolf Mail | Img = Wolf Mail - Live in Oss, NL - Oct 2012.jpg | Img_capt = Wolf Mail performing at the [[Oude Theater]], in the Netherlands, October 2012. | Background = solo_singer | Birth_name = Wolf Mail | Alias = |birth_place =[[Montreal, Canada]] | Origin = [[Montreal]], Quebec, Canada. | Instrument = Guitar, vocals | Genre = [[Blues-rock]], [[soul rock]], [[jam band]] | Occupation = musician, singer-songwriter, record producer, writer, columnist | Years_active = {{Start date|1999}}–present | Label = [[ZYX Records|ZYX]], [[Lea Productions|LEA]], [[BSMF Records|BSMF]] | URL = {{Url|www.wolf-mail.com}} | Notable_instruments = [[Fender 1957 Telecaster]]
[[Greg Bennett Guitars|Greg Bennett Custom]]
[[Mark Gilbert Guitars]] }} '''Wolf Mail''' is a Canadian [[blues rock]] guitarist and singer. Mail has recorded 6 full length albums, internationally distributed and has toured in over 26 countries. He is influenced by [[Blues music|blues]], [[jazz]], [[Soul music|soul]] and [[Country music|country]].{{cite web|title=Wolf Mail|url=http://wolf-mail.com/tour.cfm|accessdate=February 24, 2013}} ==Early years== Born in [[Montreal]], Canada, and raised in the [[South of France]] and California, Mail spent much of his early years traveling. He began playing the guitar at the age of 10, heavily influenced by [[Elmore James]] and [[John Lee Hooker]].{{cite web|title=Wolf Mail Biography|url=http://www.wolf-mail.com/bio.cfm|accessdate=January 22, 2013}} Later, Mail received some guitar lessons from [[Dave Goodman (musician)|David Goodman]], and went on to perform his first gig at 14. He left home at 17 to tour with his own band.{{cite web|title=Mark Gilberg Guitars|url=http://www.markgilbertguitars.com/wolf-mail|accessdate=January 22, 2013}} ==Career== Mail recorded two independent albums in the mid-'90s before signing up with ZYX records. Since then he has released six albums. His first effort [[Solid ground]] included the ballad "Hello" which stayed in the best selling music charts in Japan for three weeks and had fans declare their "favourite love song of all time".{{cite web|title=Belly up 4 blues|url=http://bellyup4blues.com/musicsubmit/wolf-mail|website=BellyUp4Blues.com|date=July 17, 2010|accessdate=January 22, 2013}}{{cite web|title=Perth Blues Club|url=http://www.perthbluesclub.com/index.php?option=com_gigcal&task=details&gigcal_bands_id=294&Itemid=|accessdate=January 22, 2013}} [[Blue Fix]] followed up which was recorded with the help of the [[Steve Miller Band]]{{citation needed|date=May 2014}}. Mail then recorded a live CD and DVD [[Live Blues in Red Square]] in Moscow, Russia. His fourth album ''[[Electric Love Soul]]'' was recorded in 2009 in LA at Doghouse studios by Grammy Award winner BB "Chung" King, and [[Robert Cray]] producer [[Dennis Walker (musician)|Dennis Walker]]. His follow up ''[[The Basement Session]]'' was recorded in Sydney, Australia, at the Basement, which has hosted artist such as Prince and [[Albert Collins]]. His sixth album, ''[[Above The Influence (Wolf Mail album)|Above The Influence]]'', was released in March 2013. Rhythms Music Magazine said it "sees Mail return to where he cut his teeth, our teeth, everyone’s teeth – again, searing electric blues."{{cite web|last=Fell|first=Samuel J.|title=Wolf Mail – Above The Influence|url=https://rhythms.com.au/reviews/wolf-mail-above-the-influence/|work=Rhythms Music Magazine|accessdate=May 27, 2014|date=November 18, 2013}} ==International== [[File:Wolf Mail playing in concert in Australia.jpg|left|thumb|Mail playing in Australia]] Mail has played several world tours during his career, with Russian and European tours in 2009 and 2010, and Asian and Australian tours in 2010 to 2012.{{cite web|title=Wolf Mail Tour details|url=http://wolf-mail.com/archives.cfm|accessdate=February 24, 2013}} Mail has a global presence and has played to sell-out tours around the world.{{cite web|title=Sell out Wolf Mail tours|url=http://wolf-mail.com/tour.cfm|accessdate=February 24, 2013}} ==Awards and recognition== ''Player Magazine Japan'' selected Mail as the "Close-up" artist of the month in June 2005.{{cite web|title=Player Magazine, Japan, magazine spread|url=http://www.wolf-mail.com/japanart1.cfm|accessdate=January 24, 2013}} Other artists have included [[Robert Cray]] and [[Brian Setzer]]. MusicOz Australia gave Wolf Mail best top 10 international performer of the year award for 2012.{{cite web|title=MusicOz Awards|url=http://www.musicoz.org/news/2012/5/20/109/2012_Winners__Top_10|accessdate=January 24, 2013}} ==Musical instruments and gear== Wolf uses Mark Gilbert WM1 signature bearing his name and Mark Gilbert BC electro-acoustic guitars and [[Fender Musical Instruments Corporation|Fender]] 1957 vintage [[Telecaster]] and [[Greg Bennett Blackbird]] semi-acoustic guitars. Wolf is endorsed by [[Carvin]] amplifier, and was one of the first artists with [[Joe Walsh]] to use the [[Carvin Bel Air]] vintage series. Wolf has been using the Bel Air since 1993. {{Gallery |title=Wolf Mail Custom Instruments |width=160 |height=170 |lines=3 |align=center |File:Wolf Mail playing the Wolf Mail Signature guitar by Mark Gilbert.jpg|Mail playing the Wolf Mail Signature guitar by Mark Gilbert |File:Wolf Mail playing the custom Mark Gilbert BC.jpg|Mail playing the custom Mark Gilbert BC }} ==Discography== *2002 – ''Solid Ground'' *2004 – ''Live!Live!Live!'' (unofficial release). *2005 – ''Blue Fix'' *2009 – ''Live Blues in Red Square'' *2010 – ''Electric Love Soul'' *2011 – ''The Basement Session'' *2012 – ''Soho Strays'' *2013 – ''Above The Influence'' ==DVDs== *''Live Blues in Red Square'' was released in 2009, and recorded at the Jazz Town Theater, in Moscow, Russia. ==Record Labels== *Japan/ Asia – BSMF Records *Europe – ZYX Records *North America – Tower Records *Australia – Across the Bend Entertainment ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.wolf-mail.com/ Wolf Mail Official Website] * [http://www.facebook.com/wolfmailmusic Wolf Mail Official Facebook Page] * [http://www.myspace.com/wolfmailband Wolf Mail Myspace] {{Persondata | NAME =Mail, Wolf | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian musician | DATE OF BIRTH =March 29, 1972 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Montreal, Canada]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mail, Wolf}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Blues rock musicians]] [[Category:Canadian blues guitarists]] [[Category:Electric blues musicians]]
